text: at 7:30 this morning the bus carrying a
party of retired people had just set out
for a day trip further south
driving through vineyards along a twisty
narrow road the bus was passing through
the village of Weiser gap when it
crashed into a lorry carrying timber
going in the opposite direction it
appears that the lorry driver had lost
control of his vehicle at the bend and
it had swerved across to the other side
of the road the bus driver tried to
avoid the lorry but it was too late
he managed to open the doors of the bus
so a handful of passengers got off at
the rest forty-one people were caught in
the conflagration a big emergency
operation has been mounted at the scene
the government and President Hollande
are monitoring the situation closely
there had been a terrible accident in
France in this past few hours that
caused the death today of about 40
people we are waiting to have more
information the French government is
totally mobilized on this tragedy the
task of identifying the remains in the
charred wreckage will not be easy and
there are questions - about what
happened the accident was at a
well-known danger spot in the French
countryside there are more and more big
vehicles - often traveling at speed and
many of the roads they use are not
suitable Hugh Schofield BBC News Paris
